h2601.definition: probably by orthographical variation for {{h2606}}; Chanamel, an Israelite; Hanameel.

h2602.definition: of uncertain derivation; perhaps the aphis or plantlouse; frost.

h2603.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2583}}); properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition); beseech, × fair, (be, find, shew) favour(-able), be (deal, give, grant (gracious(-ly), intreat, (be) merciful, have (shew) mercy (on, upon), have pity upon, pray, make supplication, × very.

h2604.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2603}}; to favor or (causatively) to entreat; shew mercy, make supplication.

h2605.definition: from {{h2603}}; favor; Chanan, the name of seven Israelites; Canan.

h2606.definition: from {{h2603}} and {{h410}}; God has favored; Chananel, probably an Israelite, from whom a tower of Jerusalem was named; Hananeel.

h2607.definition: from {{h2603}}; gracious; Chanani, the name of six Israelites; Hanani.

h2608.definition: or חֲנַנְיָהוּ; from {{h2603}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has favored; Chananjah, the name of thirteen Israelites; Hananiah.

h2609.definition: of Egyptian derivation; Chanes, a place in Egypt; Hanes.

h2610.definition: a primitive root; to soil, especially in a moral sense; corrupt, defile, × greatly, pollute, profane.

h2611.definition: from {{h2610}}; soiled (i.e. with sin), impious; hypocrite(-ical).

h2612.definition: from {{h2610}}; moral filth, i.e. wickedness; hypocrisy.

h2614.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2596}}); to be narrow; by implication, to throttle, or (reflex.) to choke oneself to death (by a rope); hang self, strangle.

h2615.definition: probably from {{h2603}}; favored; Channathon, a place in Palestine; Hannathon.

h2616.definition: a primitive root; properly, perhaps to bow (the neck only [compare {{h2603}}] in courtesy to an equal), i.e. to be kind; also (by euphemistically [compare {{h1288}}], but rarely) to reprove; shew self merciful, put to shame.

h2617.definition: from {{h2616}}; kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty; favour, good deed(-liness, -ness), kindly, (loving-) kindness, merciful (kindness), mercy, pity, reproach, wicked thing.

h2618.definition: the same as {{h2617}}; favor; Chesed, an Israelite; Hesed.

h2619.definition: from {{h2617}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has favored; Chasadjah, an Israelite; Hasadiah.

h2620.definition: a primitive root; (compare {{h982}}); to flee for protection; figuratively, to confide in; have hope, make refuge, (put) trust.

h2621.definition: from {{h2620}}; hopeful; Chosah, an Israelite; also a place in Palestine; Hosah.

h2623.definition: from {{h2616}}; properly, kind, i.e. (religiously) pious (a saint); godly (man), good, holy (one), merciful, saint, (un-) godly.

h2624.definition: feminine of {{h2623}}; the kind (maternal) bird, i.e. a stork; × feather, stork.

h2625.definition: from {{h2628}}; the ravager, i.e. a locust; caterpillar.

h2626.definition: from {{h2630}}; properly, firm, i.e. (by implication) mighty; strong.

h2627.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to {{h2637}}; deficient; wanting.

h2628.definition: a primitive root; to eat off; consume.

h2629.definition: a primitive root; to muzzle; by analogy, to stop the nose; muzzle, stop.

h2630.definition: a primitive root; properly, to (be) compact; by implication, to hoard; lay up.

h2631.definition: (Aramaic) corresponding to {{h2630}}; to hold in occupancy; possess.

h2635.definition: (Aramaic) from a root corresponding to that of {{h2636}}; a clod; clay.

h2636.definition: reduplicated from an unused root meaning apparently to peel; a shred or scale; round thing.

h2637.definition: a primitive root; to lack; by implication, to fail, want, lessen; be abated, bereave, decrease, (cause to) fail, (have) lack, make lower, want.

h2638.definition: from {{h2637}}; lacking; hence, without; destitute, fail, lack, have need, void, want.

h2639.definition: from {{h2637}}; lack; hence, destitution; poverty, want.

h2641.definition: from {{h2637}}; want; Chasrah, an Israelite; Hasrah.

h2643.definition: from {{h2653}} (in the moral sense of covered from soil); pure; innocent.

h2644.definition: an orthographical variation of {{h2645}}; properly, to cover, i.e. (in a sinister sense) to act covertly; do secretly.

h2645.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2644}}, {{h2653}}); to cover; by implication, to veil, to encase, protect; ceil, cover, overlay.

h2646.definition: from {{h2645}}; a canopy; chamber, closet, defence.

h2647.definition: the same as {{h2646}}; Chuppah, an Israelite; Huppah.

h2648.definition: a primitive root; properly, to start up suddenly, i.e. (by implication) to hasten away, to fear; (make) haste (away), tremble.

h2650.definition: plural of {{h2646}} (compare {{h2349}}); Chuppim, an Israelite; Huppim.

h2651.definition: from an unused root of uncertain signification; a fist (only in the dual); fists, (both) hands, hand(-ful).

h2652.definition: from {{h2651}}; perhaps pugilist; Chophni, an Israelite; Hophni.

h2653.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2645}}, {{h3182}}); to cover (in protection); cover.

h2654.definition: a primitive root; properly, to incline to; by implication (literally but rarely) to bend; figuratively, to be pleased with, desire; × any at all, (have, take) delight, desire, favour, like, move, be (well) pleased, have pleasure, will, would.

h2655.definition: from {{h2654}}; pleased with; delight in, desire, favour, please, have pleasure, whosoever would, willing, wish.

h2656.definition: from {{h2654}}; pleasure; hence (abstractly) desire; concretely, a valuable thing; hence (by extension) a matter (as something in mind); acceptable, delight(-some), desire, things desired, matter, pleasant(-ure), purpose, willingly.

h2657.definition: from {{h2656}} with suffixes; my delight (is) in her; Cheptsi-bah, a fanciful name for Palestine; Hephzi-bah.

h2658.definition: a primitive root; properly, to pry into; by implication, to delve, to explore; dig, paw, search out, seek.

h2659.definition: a primitive root (perhaps rather the same as {{h2658}} through the idea of detection); to blush; figuratively, to be ashamed, disappointed; causatively, to shame, reproach; be ashamed, be confounded, be brought to confusion (unto shame), come (be put to) shame, bring reproach.

h2660.definition: from {{h2658}} or {{h2659}}; a pit of shame; Chepher, a place in Palestine; also the name of three Israelites; Hepher.

h2661.definition: from {{h2658}}; a hole; only in connection with {{h6512}}, which ought rather to be joined as one word, thus חַפַרְפֵּרָה; by reduplication from {{h2658}}; a burrower, i.e. probably a rat; mole.

h2662.definition: patronymically from {{h2660}}; a Chephrite (collectively) or descendants of Chepher; Hepherites.

h2663.definition: dual of {{h2660}}; double pit; Chapharajim, a place in Palestine; Haphraim.

h2664.definition: a primitive root; to seek; causatively, to conceal oneself (i.e. let be sought), or mask; change, (make) diligent (search), disquise self, hide, search (for, out).

h2665.definition: from {{h2664}}; something covert, i.e. a trick; search.

h2666.definition: a primitive root; to spread loose; figuratively, to manumit; be free.

h2667.definition: from {{h2666}}; something spread loosely, i.e. a carpet; precious.

h2669.definition: and חׇפְשִׁית; from {{h2666}}; (with {{h1004}}, a hospital); prostration by sickness; several.

h2670.definition: from {{h2666}}; exempt (from bondage, tax or care); free, liberty.

h2671.definition: from {{h2686}}; also by interchange for {{h6086}}; properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunder-bolt; the shaft of a spear; archer, arrow, dart, shaft, staff, wound.

h2672.definition: or חָצֵב; a primitive root; to cut or carve (wood, stone or other material); by implication, to hew, split, square, quarry, engrave; cut, dig, divide, grave, hew (out, -er), made, mason.

h2673.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2086}})); to cut or split in two; to halve; divide, × live out half, reach to the midst, participle

h2674.definition: a collective form of {{h2691}}; village; Chatsor, the name (thus simply) of two places in Palestine and of one in Arabia; Hazor.

h2675.definition: from {{h2674}} and a Aramaizing form of the feminine of {{h2319}} (compare {{h2323}}); new Chatsor, a place in Palestine; Hazor, Hadattah (as if two places).

h2676.definition: from {{h2673}}; the middle (of the night); mid(-night).

h2677.definition: from {{h2673}}; the half or middle; half, middle, mid(-night), midst, part, two parts.

h2678.definition: or חֵצִי; prolongation from {{h2671}}; an arrow; arrow.

h2679.definition: from {{h2677}} and the plural of {{h4496}}, with the article interposed; midst of the resting-places; Chatsi-ham-Menuchoth, an Israelite; half of the Manahethites.

h2680.definition: patronymically from {{h2679}}; a Chatsi-ham-Menachtite or descendant of Chatsi-ham-Menuchoth; half of the Manahethites.

h2681.definition: a collateral form of {{h2691}}; a court or abode; court.

h2682.definition: perhaps originally the same as {{h2681}}, from the greenness of a courtyard; grass; also a leek (collectively); grass, hay, herb, leek.

h2683.definition: from an unused root meaning to hold firmly; the bosom (as comprised between the arms); bosom.

h2684.definition: a collateral form of {{h2683}}, and meaning the same; arm, lap.

h2685.definition: (Aramaic) a primitive root; properly, to shear or cut close; figuratively, to be severe; hasty, be urgent.

h2686.definition: a primitive root (compare {{h2673}}); also as denominative from {{h2671}}; properly, to chop into, pierce or sever; hence, to curtail, to distribute (into ranks); to shoot an arrow; archer, × bands, cut off in the midst.

h2687.definition: from {{h2687}};	also like {{h2671}}; properly, something cutting; hence, gravel (as grit); an arrow; arrow, gravel (stone).

h2688.definition: or חַצֲצֹן תָּמָר; from {{h2686}} and {{h8558}}; division (i.e. perhaps row) of (the) palm-tree; Chatsetson-tamar, a place in Palestine; Hazezon-tamar.

h2689.definition: by reduplication from {{h2690}}; a trumpet (from its sundered or quavering note); trumpet(-er).

h2690.definition: a primitive root; properly, to surround with a stockade, and thus separate from the open country; but used only in the reduplicated form חֲצֹצֵר; or (2 Chronicles 5:12) חֲצֹרֵר; as dem. from {{h2689}}; to trumpet, i.e. blow on that instrument; blow, sound, trumpeter.

h2691.definition: (masculine and feminine); from {{h2690}} in its original sense; a yard (as inclosed by a fence); also a hamlet (as similarly surrounded with walls); court, tower, village.

h2692.definition: from {{h2691}} and {{h146}}; (the) village of Addar; Chatsar-Addar, a place in Palestine; Hazar-addar.

h2693.definition: from {{h2691}} and a feminine of {{h1408}}; (the) village of (female) Fortune; Chatsar-Gaddah, a place in Palestine; Hazar-gaddah.

h2694.definition: from {{h2691}} and {{h8484}} with the article interposed; village of the middle; Chatsar-hat-Tikon, a place in Palestine; Hazar-hatticon.

h2695.definition: by an orthographical variation for {{h2696}}; enclosure; Chetsro, an Israelite; Hezro, Hezrai.

h2696.definition: from {{h2691}}; court-yard; Chetsron, the name of a place in Palestine; also of two Israelites; Hezron.

h2697.definition: patronymically from {{h2696}}; a Chetsronite or (collectively) descendants of Chetsron; Hezronites.

h2698.definition: feminine plural of {{h2691}}; yards; Chatseroth, a place in Palestine; Hazeroth.

h2699.definition: plural masculine of {{h2691}}; yards; Chatserim, a place in Palestine; Hazerim

h2700.definition: from {{h2691}} and {{h4194}}; village of death; Chatsarmaveth, a place in Arabia; Hazarmaveth.
